intro: Lippia mcvaughii, commonly known as Texas cypress or Mexican cypress, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, narrow leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine and for making aromatic oils. Lippia mcvaughii is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native range.
